channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-15143] NPE due to Invalid KerberosTicket in UGI
item.description:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.fixKerberosTicketOrder(UserGroupInformation.java:1170) 
	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.reloginFromKeytab(UserGroupInformation.java:1247) 
	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.checkTGTAndReloginFromKeytab(UserGroupInformation.java:1157)

It could be related to jdk issue
http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8u/jdk8u-dev/jdk/rev/fd0e0898721c
item.summary: NPE due to Invalid KerberosTicket in UGI

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This will happen when a destroyed ticket is being renewed by checkTGTAndReloginFromKeytab.

We need to add a check similar to the following jdk check introduced as part of JDK-8163103.
http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8u/jdk8u-dev/jdk/rev/fd0e0898721c

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Failure of TestRaceWhenRelogin is not related to the patch. The test fails without the patch as well.
I have raised HADOOP-15144 for failure of TestRaceWhenRelogin
+1 for the patch. I will commit it today.

msingh
On a second look at the KerberosTicket code, the destroy method is public and is not synchronized, and therefore it is possible that server is set to null but destroyed flag is not set. We may get a bit conservative and check for getServer() returning null as well?
Thanks for the review jnp, the v2 patch adds a ticket.getServer == null check as suggested. Please have a look again.

I have committed this to trunk, however keeping the bug open to get it committed to branch-2.
msingh, could you please provide a branch-2 patch?

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #13421 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/13421/)
HADOOP-15143. NPE due to Invalid KerberosTicket in UGI. Contributed by (jitendra: rev d31c9d8c495794a803fb20729b5ed6b374e23eb4)

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/UserGroupInformation.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/TestFixKerberosTicketOrder.java

The test wasn't ported to branch-2 in the original jira HADOOP-13433 which introduced the function fixKerberosTicketOrder.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-13433?focusedCommentId=15838605&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15838605

I have attached the fix for branch-2 skipping the test.
Thanks for the commit jnp. I have attached the patch for branch-2.

Committed to branch-2 as well. Thanks to msingh.
FYI we should cherry pick the commit into branch-3.0, branch-2.8, branch-2.7 and branch-2.6.

Hi jnp your commit made it into branch-2, so it will be in 2.10.0 (if it's released)

just cherry-picked the commit to branch-2.9 for the 2.9.1 release.

Also cherry picked the trunk commit to branch-3.0 for the 3.0.1 release.
Just cherry picked into 2.8, 2.7 and 2.6. There were very minor conflict in spaces in warning log message.
